WorkItem.ClosedComment:
As part of our move to GitHub, we're closing our CodePlex suggestions and asking that people move them to the GitHub issue tracker for further discussion.  Some feature requests may already be active on GitHub, so please make sure to look for an existing issue before filing a new one.

You can find our GitHub issue tracker here:
https://github.com/microsoft/typeScript/issues
WorkItem.Description:
`Element` should contain a `classList` property returning a `DOMTokenList`. How can I contribute this?  

[1]: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/hh968446.aspx
WorkItem.Summary: Missing classList property on Element interface

Comments.Message: The best way right now is just to let us know.  In the (hopefully near) future, we'd like to also be able to take pull requests where users can send patches.

I created a PR for this, and referenced this issue. Unfortunately Codeplex is in each and every way inferior to Bitbucket and Github, so it didn't create a link.

See http://typescript.codeplex.com/SourceControl/network/forks/huizendveld/TypeScript/contribution/3450
Assigning to Jonathan who is tracking our requests.

This is currently by design.  The `classList` property is on the `HTMLElement` interface, as implemented in current FF and IE.  For example, these There is inconsistency still here, with some of the newer DOM specs moving this property to ``Element`.  The DOM typing we include in lib.d.ts is autogenerated from standards IDL, so we will typically wait for browser consistency to lead to changes in the IDL we base the typings off of before making spot changes like this.   You are of course free to use a customized version of lib.d.ts for your own applications.
